intro: Meibomia tenella var. longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy texture, while the flowers are usually white or pale pink. This variant is distinguished by its longer pedicels compared to other varieties of Meibomia tenella.
